fields.title: Can Contain Liquid
fields.description: Whether this block can contain the liquid. For example, if the liquid type is `water`, this means the block can be waterlogged.

fields.title: Liquid Type
fields.description: The type of liquid this detection rule is for. Currently, `water` is the only supported liquid type. If this field is omitted, `water` will be the liquid type by default.

fields.title: Liquid Reaction
fields.description:
How the block reacts to flowing water. Must be one of the following options:
"blocking" - The default value for this field. The block stops the liquid from flowing.
"broken" - The block is destroyed completely.
"popped" - The block is destroyed and its item is spawned.
"no_reaction" - The block is unaffected; visually, the liquid will flow through the block.

fields.title: Stops Liquid Flowing From Direction
fields.description: When a block contains a liquid, controls the directions in which the liquid can't flow out from the block. Also controls the directions in which a block can stop liquid flowing into it if `no_reaction` is set for the `on_liquid_touches` field. Can be a list of the following directions: "up", "down", "north", "south", "east", "west". The default is an empty list; this means that liquid can flow out of all directions by default.

fields.title: Use Liquid Clipping
fields.description: Whether this block uses the encompassing collider to visually clip the liquid. The encompassing collider is the smallest single AABB that contains all of the block's colliders.
